subject: Medicine
title: The Rise of Insulin
description: A 60-second lesson on The Rise of Insulin.

hook.text: Before 1922, a diagnosis of Type 1 diabetes was a death sentence. Children died within months.

buildup.text: Banting and Best extracted insulin from dog pancreases and injected it into a dying 14-year-old boy.

discovery.text: The boy's blood sugar dropped to normal. He gained weight and strength. Insulin worked.

twist.text: Banting sold the insulin patent to the University of Toronto for $1, wanting it available to everyone.

climax.text: Insulin transformed diabetes from a death sentence into a manageable condition for millions worldwide.

punchline.text: One dollar bought the world a lifesaving drug.

quiz.question: Why did Banting sell the insulin patent for $1?
options: He wanted insulin to be affordable for everyone
The university forced him to sell cheaply
Insulin was not yet proven to work
